content: birch trees by julia marsh a simple lacy scarf with five panels of branching pattern repeats surrounded by a moss stitch edging border inspired by birch woods surrounding the croft size 158cm/62 ins x 22cm/9 ins yarn double knitting weight yarn 380m/415yds needles pair of straight 4 5mm/us 7 knitting needles notions tapestry needle for weaving in ends instructions cast on 51 stitches with 4 5mm straight knitting needles in dk weight yarn change the needle size if required to achieve a looser or closer texture for the lace pattern row 1 ws *k1 p1 repeat from * to end finishing with a knit stitch row 2 repeat row 1 row 3 repeat row 1 the above three row are the border edge of the work the following four row make up the lace pattern which is repeated throughout the work row 4 k1 p1 k1 *p1 k1 k2tog yf k1 yf k2tog tbl k1 p1 repeat 4 times from * until three stitches remain k1 p1 k1 row 5 k1 p1 k1 *k1 p7 k1 repeat from * until three stitches remain k1 p1 k1 row 6 k1 p1 k1 *p1 k2tog yf k3 yf k2tog tbl p1 repeat from * four times until three stitches remain k1 p1 k1 text and graphics © julia marsh - hand knitted things 2014 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use it may not be sold in full or in part and products made using this pattern may not be sold row 7 repeat row 5 continue working the four pattern row 4 to 7 until required length of scarf is achieved complete the work repeating row 1 to 3 to create a border for the finished edge cast off weave in loose ends and block scarf abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit two stitches together tbl knit the stitches through the back of the loop yf bring the yarn to the front of the work ws wrong side text and graphics © julia marsh - hand knitted things 2014 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use it may not be sold in full or in part and products made using this pattern may not be sold
